title: Center of mass - two boards and a cube

content.question: Three objects are arranged as shown: a solid board of length <math alttext="L sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> and uniform density, a board that, except for a small hole in its upper half, is identical to the solid board, and a small cube whose center is at a height of <math alttext="the fraction L sub 0, end sub, over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>. Which of the following correctly ranks the <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math>-coordinates of the center of mass <math alttext="y sub S B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>y</mi><mtext>SB</mtext></msub></math>, <math alttext="y sub B H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>y</mi><mtext>BH</mtext></msub></math>, and <math alttext="y sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>y</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math> of the solid board, the board with the hole, and the small cube, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="y sub S B is greater than y sub B H, which is greater than y sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>y</mi><mtext>SB</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mtext>BH</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="y sub B H is greater than y sub S B, which is greater than y sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>y</mi><mtext>BH</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mtext>SB</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="y sub S B equals y sub C, which is greater than y sub B H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>y</mi><mtext>SB</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mtext>BH</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="y sub B H is greater than y sub S B, which equals y sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>y</mi><mtext>BH</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mtext>SB</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="y sub S B equals y sub C, which is greater than y sub B H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>y</mi><mtext>SB</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mtext>BH</mtext></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
